content.description: A financial analyst reports that for people who work in the finance industry, the probability that a randomly selected person will have a tattoo is 0.20.
content.question: Which of the following is the best interpretation of the probability 0.20 ?

choices.label: For all workers in the United States, 20% will work in finance.
For all finance workers, 20% will have a tattoo.
For all people with tattoos, 20% will work in finance.
For a specific group of 5 finance workers, 1 will have a tattoo.
For a specific group of 5 people with a tattoo, 1 will work in finance.

content.answer: For all finance workers, 20% will have a tattoo.

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
